intro: Urophyllum talangense, commonly known as the Talangense uruphyllo, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
